{{Radio station | image =| name = 90.3 and 95.3 ABC Coast FM| callsign = 4SCR| airdate = December 14, 1992 | frequency = 90.3 [[Megahertz|mHz]] [[frequency modulation|FM]] Sunshine Coast
95.3 [[Megahertz|mHz]] [[frequency modulation|FM]] Coast hinterland/Gympie| area = [[Sunshine Coast, Queensland|Sunshine Coast]] and [[Gympie]]| owner = [[Australian Broadcasting Corporation]] | format = [[Talk radio|Talk]] | website = [http://www.abc.net.au/sunshine/ http://www.abc.net.au/sunshine/] | }} '''90.3 and 95.3 ABC Coast FM''' is an [[ABC Local Radio]] station based in [[Maroochydore]]. The station broadcasts to the [[Sunshine Coast, Queensland|Sunshine Coast]] region of [[Queensland]]. This includes the towns of [[Nambour, Queensland|Nambour]], [[Caloundra]], [[Noosa]] and [[Gympie]]. It was originally set-up to target the youth market and broadcast to the Sunshine Coast from a studio at [[612 ABC Brisbane]]. The station is now a news, current affairs and [[adult contemporary music]] station. Unlike most other ABC Local stations outside the capital cities, ABC Coast FM [http://www.abc.net.au/sunshine/?nav=true originates] most of its own programming and has a higher music content. ==References== {{cite web |title=The Origins of Coast FM |url= http://www.abc.net.au/local/stories/2008/03/08/2184132.htm|date=2008-03-08 |accessdate=2008-04-28 |publisher=[[ABC Online]] }} ==See also== * [[List of Australian radio stations]] {{ABC Local Radio}} {{Coord|-26.652311|N|153.090127|E|display=title}} {{DEFAULTSORT:90.3 Abc Coast Fm}} [[Category:Radio stations in Queensland]]
